com.spotify.sdk.android.player

Class AudioRingBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spotify.sdk.android.player.AudioRingBuffer

  • public class AudioRingBuffer
extends Object
    A ring buffer to hold audio data before they can be written to the audio output.

    This implementation uses write/peek/remove pattern - the items are written to the buffer by one thread, then read from the buffer by another and written to the audio output.

    At this point, the data is not yet removed from the buffer as we need to know first how many samples we were able to write to the output. Once this method returns, we can remove the written samples from the buffer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AudioRingBuffer

        public AudioRingBuffer(int capacity)

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public int write(short[] data)
        Write samples to the buffer.
        Parameters:
        data - Source array to copy data from. All elements from this array will be copied to the ring buffer.
        Returns:
        The number of items written to the buffer.

      • write

        public int write(short[] data,
                 int itemsCount)
        Write samples to the buffer.
        Parameters:
        data - Source array to copy data from.
        itemsCount - The number of items to copy from the data array. The items will be copied starting from index 0.
        Returns:
        The number of items written to the buffer.

      • peek

        public int peek(short[] outArray)
        Gets elements without removing them from the buffer.
        Parameters:
        outArray - Destination array that the read items will be copied to.
        Returns:
        The number of items read.

      • remove

        public void remove(int itemCount)
        Removes items from the buffer. The items are not really removed or deleted but the ring buffer's internal pointers are moved to positions that indicate an empty buffer.
        Parameters:
        itemCount - The number of items to remove from the buffer, starting from current read position.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all items from the buffer.
